chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: stack nat

Goal:
tau1 (f A) = f_s (tau1 A)

Premises:
stack = fun X : Type => list (card X) : Type -> Type Arguments stack _%type_scope
f_s = fix f_s (x : string nat) : string bool := match x with | [] => [] | a :: x0 => to_bitstring a ++ [false] ++ f_s x0 end : string nat -> string bool
f = fun P : stack nat => map f_c P : stack nat -> stack bool
tau1 = fix tau1 (X : Type) (A : stack X) {struct A} : string X := match A with | [] => [] | (x, _) :: A0 => x ++ tau1 X A0 end : forall X : Type, stack X -> string X Arguments tau1 {X}%type_scope
MPCP = fun '(x, y, P) => exists A : stack nat, A <<= (x, y) :: P /\ x ++ tau1 A = y ++ tau2 A : card nat * stack nat -> Prop
f_s_app : forall x y : list nat, f_s (x ++ y) = f_s x ++ f_s y
MPCPb = fun '(x, y, P) => exists A : stack bool, A <<= (x, y) :: P /\ x ++ tau1 A = y ++ tau2 A : card bool * stack bool -> Prop
PCPX = fun (X : Type) (P : stack X) => exists A : list (card X), A <<= P /\ A <> [] /\ tau1 A = tau2 A : forall X : Type, stack X -> Prop Arguments PCPX {X}%type_scope
f_c = fun '(x, y) => (f_s x, f_s y) : string nat * string nat -> string bool * string bool
f_equal_nat : forall (B : Type) (f : nat -> B) (x y : nat), x = y -> f x = f y
Nat.iter : nat -> forall A : Type, (A -> A) -> A -> A
PCP = PCPX : stack nat -> Prop
semi_decider = fun (X : Type) (f : X -> nat -> bool) (P : X -> Prop) => forall x : X, P x < -> (exists n : nat, f x n = true) : forall X : Type, (X -> nat -> bool) -> (X -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments semi_decider {X}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
Fin.eq_dec : forall x y : Fin.t ?n, {x = y} + {x <> y} where ?n : [A : stack nat |- nat]
dPCPb = dPCP : stack bool -> Prop
PCPb = PCPX : stack bool -> Prop
iPCPb = fun P : stack bool => exists A : list nat, (forall a : nat, a el A -> a < | P |) /\ A <> [] /\ itau1 P A = itau2 P A : stack bool -> Prop
dPCP = fun (X : Type) (P : stack X) => exists u : string X, derivable P u u : forall X : Type, stack X -> Prop Arguments dPCP {X}%type_scope
der_sing : forall (P : stack ?X) (x y : list ?X), (x, y) el P -> derivable P x y where ?X : [A : stack nat |- Type]
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P [] -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, P l
itau2 = fix itau2 (X : Type) (P : stack X) (A : list nat) {struct A} : string X := match A with | [] => [] | i :: A0 => snd (nth i P ([], [])) ++ itau2 X P A0 end : forall X : Type, stack X -> list nat -> string X Arguments itau2 {X}%type_scope _ _%list_scope
itau1 = fix itau1 (X : Type) (P : stack X) (A : list nat) {struct A} : string X := match A with | [] => [] | i :: A0 => fst (nth i P ([], [])) ++ itau1 X P A0 end : forall X : Type, stack X -> list nat -> string X Arguments itau1 {X}%type_scope _ _%list_scope
der_cons : forall (P : stack ?X) (x y : list ?X) (u v : string ?X), (x, y) el P -> derivable P u v -> derivable P (x ++ u) (y ++ v) where ?X : [A : stack nat |- Type]
tau2 = fix tau2 (X : Type) (A : stack X) {struct A} : string X := match A with | [] => [] | (_, y) :: A0 => y ++ tau2 X A0 end : forall X : Type, stack X -> string X Arguments tau2 {X}%type_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.Even = fun n : nat => exists m : nat, n = 2 * m : nat -> Prop Arguments PeanoNat.Nat.Even _%nat_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.Odd = fun n : nat => exists m : nat, n = 2 * m + 1 : nat -> Prop Arguments PeanoNat.Nat.Odd _%nat_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.clearbit = fun a n : nat => PeanoNat.Nat.ldiff a (PeanoNat.Nat.shiftl 1 n) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments PeanoNat.Nat.clearbit (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.land = fun a b : nat => Nat.bitwise andb a a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.land (_ _)%nat_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.setbit = fun a n : nat => PeanoNat.Nat.lor a (PeanoNat.Nat.shiftl 1 n) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments PeanoNat.Nat.setbit (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.log2 = fun n : nat => Nat.log2_iter (Nat.pred n) 0 1 0 : nat -> nat Arguments Nat.log2 _%nat_scope
Nat.lxor = fun a b : nat => Nat.bitwise xorb (Nat.max a b) a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.lxor (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.lor = fun a b : nat => Nat.bitwise orb (Nat.max a b) a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.lor (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.ltb = fun n m : nat => Nat.leb (S n) m : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments Nat.ltb (_ _)%nat_scope
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
